pages.text: "A generator that uses the heat of lava or other burnable resources to produce energy"$(p)The Heat Generator utilizes heat to produce energy. The more heat energy it receives, the higher its power production is. There are two forms of production: passive generation and active generation.
*It does not matter whether or not is the lava a source block. An adjacent lava source and a flowing lava stream will have the same results.)

pages.title: Passive Generation
pages.text: The Heat Generator can passively produce energy via adjacent heat sources, for example lava.*$(p)The lava can be anywhere adjacent to the heat generator, whether above it or below it, there will be no difference. You can also lava-log the heat generator, totalling up to 6 viable sides to provide passive generation.

pages.title: Active Generation
pages.text: The Heat Generator can actively produce energy via consuming combustibles (such as lava)/heat energy (nearby heaters or $(l:pipes/heat)Thermodynamic Conductors$(/l)). This often results in a much higher production rate than passive generation.
